name: Rice Noodle Salad With Salted Peanuts and Herbs
description: This satisfying salad has rice noodles and vegetables in equal measure, making it bright, crisp and light. The peanuts add richness and a salty crunch, along with a dose of protein. And the dressing is a little spicy and a lot tangy, with a pungent kick from fish sauce, garlic and ginger. The recipe makes just enough dressing to lightly coat the vegetables and noodles, but if you’re a fan of heavily dressed salads, consider doubling it. Any leftover will keep in the fridge for up to a week, and you’ll be happy to drizzle it on fish, chicken and all kinds of vegetables.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, weeknight, noodles, salads and dressings, vegetables
keywords: carrot, cucumber, fish sauce, herbs, radish, rice noodles, fall, spring, summer, main course
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons lime juice (from about 2 limes), plus more to taste
2 tablespoons grapeseed or other neutral oil
1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated
1 garlic clove, finely grated or mashed to a paste
1 to 2 bird’s-eye or serrano chiles, thinly sliced
1 cup thinly sliced cucumber, preferably Persian
Handful of lettuce leaves, torn if large
Large handful of fresh, soft herbs, such as dill, mint and cilantro
1/2 cup roasted and salted peanuts, coarsely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, toss radishes and carrot with vinegar, sugar and salt, and let sit while preparing remaining ingredients.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Immediately transfer to a colander and rinse under cold water to cool. Set aside to drain.
In a small bowl, prepare the dressing: Stir together lime juice, oil, fish sauce, ginger, garlic and chiles.
Pile noodles in a large bowl, then top with radish and carrot mixture and any juices from the bowl, cucumber, lettuce, scallions, herbs, peanuts and eggs, if using. Drizzle the dressing over the top.
